TopicTitle: Cronus Titan hauler SSTO - 80 tons to LKO - Low density update now "only" 422 parts

Articles.Content:
I decided i should build a mk3 spaceplane and i finally have it finished and i must say it is quite a big one, Presenting the 

> 
> After realising most people could never actually load and fly Cronus i put it on a diet, be warned this version does not perform nearly as well as the full version, if you can i insist on downloading the 587 part craft.
> 
> This version contains no RCS control and next to no SAS control, flight stability and maneuverability is also compromised for the sake of less parts.
> 
> ![j7Lry04.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/j7Lry04.jpg)
> 
> **Download link:** 
> 
> [**http://www./download/0qycwumzksbad5k/Cronus+-+Titan+hauler+SSTO+%28low+density%29.craft**](http://www./download/0qycwumzksbad5k/Cronus+-+Titan+hauler+SSTO+%28low+density%29.craft)
> 
> 

**Cronus titan hauler SSTO** 

![XodDJLF.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/XodDJLF.jpg)

![TF9gx7o.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/TF9gx7o.jpg)

![WGY4BSH.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/WGY4BSH.jpg)

**Description:** 

Capable of carrying 80 tons into LKO with engines any stock SSTO would be jealous of, Cronus burns fuel evenly (That was a head ache to figure out lol), it is capable of 100-300km orbits depending on the pilot (into the millions if storage is used for delta V) and in the atmosphere it flies like a dream with a 140m/s take off and extremely stable once in the air, flyable without SAS control even for the less skilled pilots

**Cost:** 688,420

**Weight:** 556.3 Tons

**Part count:** 587 

(Nearly down to 1 per ton not bad imo)

**Action groups:** 

**1:** Toggle Turbo jets

**2:** Toggle Rapiers

**3:** Toggle Rapier engine mode

**4:** Toggle aero spikes

**5:** Toggle solar panels

**Flight instructions:** 

On launch picth up to 40 degree and continue until 12km, at 12km bring the pitch down to +5degree and gain speed until 800-1100m/s, at 800-1100m/s bring the pitch up to +20 degree until 20km, at 20km you will need to hit action group 4 engaging aero spikes, at 22-24km you will need to hit action group 3 to switch rapier engine mode, after turbo jets die off at 26km bring the pitch to +30 degree and continue until a 100km apoapsis then procede with orbital maneuver, before re entry you will need to move some fuel into forward tanks for flight stability. Good luck and have fun.

**Download link:**

[**http://www./download/ctpapi4ix11rtxs/Cronus+-+Titan+hauler+SSTO.craft**](http://www./download/ctpapi4ix11rtxs/Cronus+-+Titan+hauler+SSTO.craft)

Woah ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)

Really now, I can't quite put a finger on whether those wings have more lift than drag, but a pic of it in space is the answer that I should need, but justifying that answer would mean I personally give this ride a go ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Really loving these radical-dynamic crazy designs that just.. work! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

wow, amazing! +rep

gonna fly it ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Maybe reducing the number of solar panels might help a bit?

only has 12, could probably remove some of the internals but it removes a lot of performance and reliability, one problem is the 45 air breathing engines, that adds 45 air intakes and cubic struts to hold them, theres 90 parts not including the 60 engines (60 once you include the aero spikes lol), really i just went too big lol. im amazed i kept it under 600 parts as it is ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Well i managed to get it down to a 440 part count, not as good as the full version but more people will be able to load it now.

Well, that's more or less good news ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) What did you do?

> 
> Well, that's more or less good news ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) What did you do?

No more RCS, no more SAS, less flight stability and less structural integrity, it did come at a cost

You know that in the new system, you only need 1 intake for every two air breathing engines. More or less. Going with a 1.5/1 ratio would be safer, so you could probably drop 10 of the intakes right there. Not much of a part drop though... probably not enough to make a difference.
The turbo jets overheat and lose power before I can reach 800-1100m/s. What do you do to prevent that?

> 
> The turbo jets overheat and lose power before I can reach 800-1100m/s. What do you do to prevent that?

Rapiers to assist you to the 800-1100m/s barrier.

> 
> The turbo jets overheat and lose power before I can reach 800-1100m/s. What do you do to prevent that?

Oh. So THAT's why my trimaran designs (wing- FUEL-cargo-FUEL-wing) didn't work. I had about a quarter of the amount of power I actually needed.

Now that we've confirmed it's possible to SSTO two cargo bay's worth, hmm... I think an SSTO mothership might be in the cards.

>

I removed some old mods and also the physics.cfg file and it works like a charm no overheating. Made it into orbit.
